website_summaries.verdict: A very stable yet light weight adjustable bench that’s perfect for dumbbell work.
pros: A robust pop-pin adjustment system keeps the bench stable at all positions
Folds up slim for storage in small spaces
cons: Seat and back padding are thin

customer_reviews.title: That's exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it, because this bench has a decline adjustment, works really great. Description said it can hold up to 500 lbs , I myself weight 170. bench about 225 for the weights, really stable. Definitely will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Wu

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered on time, and the best part was no assembly required. Enjoying this easy to operate multi-angle bench. Highly recommended. I have purchased benches prior and none of them work, as they were bulky, rigid, and hard to move around the house. But this one is light, but sturdy and also easy to move around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Suyash Awasthi

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!  Glad we got this one.
customer_reviews.text: Read a ton of reviews about several different brands and different benches. This one was on sale when I was looking for benches and I'm so glad I decided to go for it. Fast delivery, my husband put it together and we love it. So glad we got it.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia

customer_reviews.title: Great product even better service!
customer_reviews.text: Buy this bench with confidence. The customer service of this company is outstanding. I had a small issue and they took care of it immediately. This bench folds into a tight compact space. It feels very sturdy as well. No assembly which is also really nice
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Easiest thing to build out the package! Open snap into position and insert the safety pin and bam! Folds amazing for storage! Its super sturdy! Im 6'1 300 pounds little husky just looking to tone up a bit and worked out great!
customer_reviews.author: Junior A

customer_reviews.title: Folds Up and Stores Great
customer_reviews.text: This bench was exactly what I was looking for. I have very little space and need to be able to store my equipment after use. This folds up nicely so I can move it out of the way when not in use. Since it does fold up it might not be the most sturdy bench out there but for what this is it’s great. I’m 6’2 and have been using this for a couple of months. Would recommend for those who have to store fitness equipment after use.
customer_reviews.author: ZMoney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, folding, adjustable weight bench
customer_reviews.text: Had bought the original bench but had to donate it because I was moving to a home which didn’t have as much space. Finally saw this improved model which I would be able to use and then store easily near my workout area, so I ordered it. First, putting it together meant only unfolding it and attaching the foot support. Presto! Done! What a difference. My 5’8” height fit perfectly on the bench when seated or kneeling. It’s very sturdy and, as with the first model, having the different incline/decline levels makes it more valuable than a flat bench. Very easy to fold up and store. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Larissa

customer_reviews.title: Easy adjustment and Stable
customer_reviews.text: For the price point you can’t beat this. Easy adjustment and stable. I had bought a different model a little cheaper and sent it back. It was wobbly and difficult to adjust. The fly bird gets everything right high enough quality for home, easy to adjust, and pricing.
customer_reviews.author: PIN

customer_reviews.title: unfolds and sets up easily literally less then 10 seconds
customer_reviews.text: extremely convenient and sturdy don't waste your time viewing other products I've bought 3 different and nothing comes close
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic bench
customer_reviews.text: Can’t seem to find anything bad about this product. It’s exactly as described, no faults. I’d recommend this bench to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: That Webb Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap piece of unsafe junk. Decline setting useless.
customer_reviews.text: As others have noted, this is more or less functional but very cheap. Also, very tall and therefore difficult to establish a safe, stable posture when on back. I'm 5'11 and fit and use moderately heavy weights while on the bench(flat and incline) and had to build a platform to get my feet in a safe position for beginning, middle, and end. The foot gravs for decline are pathetically small except for very small people, not anyone with a normal sized calf or ankles; therefore decline setting is useless. When send this piece of junk back but its slim pickings with the Corona sweeping the world presently.
customer_reviews.author: Tro

customer_reviews.title: Great Bench
customer_reviews.text: Well made, sturdy and already put together. I love how easy it is to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: S. Eden

customer_reviews.title: Made for giants.
customer_reviews.text: Unless your taller than me (6’ 1”), this won’t work for you. Way too high off the ground unless you’re a giant. Super good quality. Insanely easy assembly.
customer_reviews.author: James Mattison

customer_reviews.title: Very wobbly
customer_reviews.text: The bench was easy to put together but was incredibly wobbly. Didn’t feel safe using it. Also the item had stripped bolts so it must have already been returned. The one at dicks sporting goods is on sale for 130 and much better quality.
customer_reviews.author: hannah

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy plastic disappointment - this from a tiny, Middle-Aged, woman. Guys - don’t buy this
customer_reviews.text: Too tall and very flimsy. I bought this because it was available during Covid-19 isolation. It’s garbage. Vinyl, light weight, unstable. I weigh 110 lbs and lift fairly heavy for my weight, height, age. This bench makes me nervous and is shaped weird (the seat). Doesn’t allow me to do anything well and the materials to include bolts and fasteners are super flimsy. It is not likely that this bench will hold anywhere near the 500-600 pound load the manufacturer claims. It seems particularly flimsy at the ends of the bench - which precludes preacher curls over the seat back or dips from any area of the bench. The caps on the feet fall off constantly.
customer_reviews.author: sbsc

customer_reviews.title: Not very stable
customer_reviews.text: Not a stable bench when you are using it incline position
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: The metal and the welded location broke - company gave full refund for trouble
customer_reviews.text: I gave this bench to my husband for Christmas 2018. We liked it until today, May 2019. He was on the bench holding 170 pounds and the metal split. He is 220 pounds. So there was a total of 390 lbs on the bench. It was incredibly dangerous and he was lucky the weights didn't injure him. Because the bench broke in mid-use at 6 months old while he was within the recommended pound limit, I say think twice before you buy this bench. Update August 2019 The company contacted my via email and offered a full refund. I am grateful they reached out independently to try and correct the wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Cara Tarullo

customer_reviews.title: BENCH TOO HIGH ! Tallest Bench I’ve ever sat on
customer_reviews.text: Nice bench, sturdy and well made but I can’t understand the height of this bench. 21 inches is the highest bench I’ve ever sat on. Even their other bench is lower 16 inches. I’m 6’1” and it just doesn’t feel comfortable. I wonder why Flybird did this? Perhaps they should advertise, this bench if for 6’4 and above ? Wish they had this in a normal bench height (16-18 inches height). Love the auto lock in place and the padding though. Super plush and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Took me five minutes
customer_reviews.text: Not sturdy at all. Moment I sat down the thing was ready to collapse. The legs immediately widened away from each other against my weight. This is supposed to support my height/weight class, which is why I purchased it, but just sitting in it, I can hear the rubber rubbing against the floor and thinking it's going to give in. Sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: O'Neil Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Solid but too high
customer_reviews.text: For home workouts, the new normal during covid, this bench seems pretty solid so far. I do have one gripe with it though, it is too high. A proper weight bench should be 17-18 inches high so that a solid base can be made with the ground with the lifter's feet. This one is nearly 22 inches high. At 6'1" and an avid lifter, this bench is too high to have my knees bent at the proper angle to make a solid foundation. I bought some platforms so that I can lift with the proper technique but really it is an oversite in this bench's design.
customer_reviews.author: The Viking

customer_reviews.title: Great bench
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for 3 months and its pretty sturdy. It comes assembled which deserves a 5 star by itself. Cons: - Its better suited for tall people. I am 5'7" and my feet doesnt touch the ground completely when I sit on it. There is a foot rest, so it is okay. Someone 5'10" plus would find it very convenient - It isn't anti-slip, it relies on your weight to stay in place. So it is good for bench press, incline chest press and similar exercises. I tried inline dumbbell tricep kickbacks and the bench was moving a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Sarvajit

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOU ARE OVER 6'
customer_reviews.text: I made a mistake, saw few reviews of people over 6' saying they are happy with it. I got it, it's solid, but I'm 6'2", fit body and damn it is small for my lower body! When you set it flat or decline for ab exercise, there is a HUGE gap between two halves. And there are metal parts there so when you start doing crunches your buttocks basically slide into that gap right on top of metal edges. It's impossible to exercise like that. I'm pretty sure short people actually don't get that, but if you are tall like me, do not get that one!
customer_reviews.author: Maxed

customer_reviews.title: Who thought these dimensions made sense?
customer_reviews.text: Slightly too tall. Seat is too wide. Bench material is too flimsy. (I wouldn't recommend using with heavy weights) Why not measure a standard bench and just make that? Oh also, the main hinge point when converting the bench from storage to use mode took a narly chunk out of my hand, so there's also safety features lacking.
customer_reviews.author: Jobot

customer_reviews.title: Does not feel safe
customer_reviews.text: When i use this bench to bench press for my power rack and im using way under the max load of the bench, it flexes as you do you lift and also this bench is very high off the ground your feet don't contact the ground very well and im 6'0 lastly the back rest is to narrow doesn't give much support should be wider.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Considering returning the bench........
customer_reviews.text: The bench itself is well made. I feel like the back part is very narrow. I am 5 4 foot tall and feel the bench is rather high off the ground. I have been trying to find "flybird" exercises to work abs and legs and have not been able to find the info I am looking for. I am not a weight lifter and want a bench that I can do different exercises on other than just weights. Some of the benches I saw came with work out apps . I have searched for the company website "flybird" and am yet to find it.
customer_reviews.author: Beagleluva

customer_reviews.title: It's a bench
customer_reviews.text: If you're reading this far into the reviews, you should stop what you're doing and do as many push ups as you possibly can right now. Buying this weight bench will help you perform specific workouts, but the impediment to fitness is your own mind. We both know you can get jacked with bodyweight exercises. Do as many push ups as you can right now, and buy the bench. It's good enough for what you need. Buying this won't fix it. You have to work at it. And you can. It's totally possible. Get after it. You know what to do.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality considering the price
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy enough. It took less than 5 minutes to assemble it. The instructions were easy to follow. Easy to adjust and made of high-quality materials. It compares favorably to benches that cost two or three times as much. Perfect for me, as I will probably never load it with more than 450 pounds. I am not sure if I will trust it if I were to bench more than 300 pounds. The position of the feet attachment cannot be adjusted. It might be uncomfortable if you are too tall or too short. Also, it is very easy to fold it for storage. Although, I will not be benefiting from that feature.
customer_reviews.author: Salvador Vallejo

customer_reviews.title: Given what's available to buy right now (nothing), this is a decent purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Let me preface this with the fact that I have worked out at gyms for about 10 years now. That said, this is my first time building out a home gym setup of my own. Given the current situation with COVID there were not many choices in stock. This was a decently priced bench that was in stock and provided the features I needed - Incline, decline, Foot hold for abs, etc. Overall it feels a little cheap. Is it stable? Yes. Is it functional? Yes. Will I be replacing it when I have the option? Yes, most likely. But overall does it do the job I purchased it for? Yes, it does. Would recommend for those in need.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great Adjustable Bench
customer_reviews.text: Great bench for the money. Don’t go any cheaper! Make sure you get this 2020 version and not he cheaper, older design. It’s not commercial grade of course, however, it’s plenty sturdy. No assembly required, folds in half, and has great adjustment settings for both the seat and upper bench. Plenty wide and light weight. I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: P. Kennan

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Is this the best bench on the market? No but, it works pretty good. I use it for dumbbell workouts and it’s not the most sturdy but, I’m in control of the weights. I use 90lb dumbbells and feel very comfortable in the bench. I’ve been using it for 3 months and it’s holding up well. Is it going to last a lifetime... no. Would I buy it again.... absolutely. Look at all the obese people now from being locked down and are more at risk from covid. Don’t be one of them even if your freedom is being taken away. Workout.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck t

customer_reviews.title: Back is a bit short, gap between seat and back, seat has some quality control issue
customer_reviews.text: It is very easy to assemble, just two things and you're done. It has good cushion, however, when using it for ab crunch, the gap between the seat and the back is uncomfortably big, so I wedged a towel in between to fill that gap. The seat is a bit short, I am 5'11'' and the end of the bench is touching the middle of the backside of my head. Seat has some quality control issue with uneven seams or seams coming apart. Contacted seller and they offered for partial refund and seat replacement to address it, so customer service is good.
customer_reviews.author: VerifiedBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bench - just one small gripe
customer_reviews.text: The only gripe as mentioned in some other reviews is that the bench is a bit higher than the ones I'm used to, which makes some basic moves lying down feel awkward. My workaround was to place a stool in the front to help balance me out which took care of my problem. Other than that, the major pull for me was the fold-able feature for me which was the pro that weighed out the cons. (Another con is the seat is tapered a bit too wide which makes getting off awkward.)
customer_reviews.author: jusstice101

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: not a great bench. its too high, the seat is too wide, and just feels unsturdy. would not recommend anyone purchase.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Not stable!
customer_reviews.text: long story short this is not a stable product at all. Wobbles side to side when doing exercise, the slightest imbalance in your movement can make you feel like you are about to slide off to one side. The wobble alone is a very unsettling issue and I recommend you spend your money on a different product. quality-wise it is just ok (gets the job done for quarantine) but I can tell that it will not last long as I already see bad creasing in the "leather". Padding quality is not the best, you would never find this product in a commercial gym.
customer_reviews.author: Mario F.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy well made
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this bench. just got it on Saturday, and have used it a few times. my biggest concern was being able to do step ups, no problem. it does not wobble at all when i do them. the padding is a little thinner than i was hopping for, but considering the price i paid, its good. I did a lot of looking around and comparing before i bought this one, it was righted #2 on many websites. Very happy with my decision. Easy to move around, as i don't have a lot of room so i have to move it to use it. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Rice

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: The first thing you see is that the bench is strongly built. It came heavily packaged and almost completely assembled; the remaining steps were simple and took about ten minutes to complete. I am 5-11 and 155 lbs. and the bench is a good fit--no instability issues. There is an unfortunate chemical smell apparently associated with the foam material in the seat and back, but it isn't too bad and will probably dissipate over time. With the bench's basically slim profile, it is easy to set along the wall (rather than break down and fold, which is not so easy) and then take out for next use; it isn't all that heavy despite its good build. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Darwin T.

customer_reviews.title: Comes pretty much fully assembled. So far seems great.
customer_reviews.text: I've been working out on this bench for the last couple of weeks using free weights and some bodyweight exercises. The range of positioning is really key to working out some harder-to-hit muscle groups so that was the selling point for me since I can't go to the gym currently. The bench adjusts easily and I haven't felt like there was any chance of it slipping position, or being anything less than extremely stable. Pads aren't exactly plush but plenty comfortable and clean off easily. Probably paid more for it than I would have liked to, might knock off a star for that depending on how it holds up, but I'm overall very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Son of a Vondruke

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Love the price, but after a week hate the product. I am not one for heavy weights, just an aging triathlete who misses the gym. First, it is too high off the ground but is marginally stable even with its narrow footprint. Second, the base/seat is far too big, long and tapers the wrong direction (outward instead of inward at the end). It is frankly ridiculous. The torso portion is too short, so my head/neck has no support - I am 6’ 1”. Third, the vinyl cover material is too thin so after only 3 uses is starting to wrinkle. Terrible purchase. Will return or throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Dorenkamp

customer_reviews.title: TOO HIGH unless you are over 6' Tall
customer_reviews.text: Too high!!! It's 21" high. I'm 5'10" and my feet are not flat on ground. You should be well over 6' Tall to use the bench safely. Description is flawed as it says for people up to 6'2" where it should say for people over that height. See below what standard height should be "A weight bench has to be the right height – not too high and not too low. The defacto standard is somewhere around 17′′ and 18′′ height"
customer_reviews.author: TexNYC

customer_reviews.title: Great Compact bench, that is worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Positives: 1) Reasonable price. 2) Compact. Folds up and easy to store behind sofa out of the way. 3) Easy to adjust to incline, decline and flat bench. 4) Sturdy, not shaky. Cons: 1) Bench has reasonable amount of cushion, but somehow still fills like it has less back support then regular bench at gym. This is easy fix though by wearing gym belt while bench pressing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hide vs sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Building a home gym during covid is a thing to do. I really needed a bench that has multiple functions and to be able to fold and hide away. Now with that being said this bench isn’t as sturdy as I would like it to be. For example if you are doing dips you can feel the back wood bend a little and you hear a creek. Same with the seat. If you are looking for a bench that can incline decline bench and easy to fold to hide this is it. If you need something sturdy this probably isn’t it for you. This bench fit my needs and I’m not planning to do anything crazy with the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Thien Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Better than the option available at my gym
customer_reviews.text: This workout bench is really comfortable. The padding is substantial and the bench itself feels a bit wider and longer than the traditional bench that is offered at my gym which is nice and so I don't have to worry about adjusting myself on it. There are multiple adjustments you can make to the seat and back to do incline or decline lifts. I'm very happy with this bench and we set it up in just a few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: What more can you ask for- perfect addition
customer_reviews.text: This bench is a perfect fit for my beginner home gym. I love to lift heavy! And this bench is up for the task. Not only is it study but it is soft. Sturdy and comfortable, if that makes sense. I love that it is adjustable and can be used as a flat, incline, or decline bench. Definitely great for varying workouts to target different muscle groups. Set up is a breeze and it folds up nicely to not take up too much space in your bedroom or garage. I'm very pleased with the purchase and I look forward to many years of use.
customer_reviews.author: L. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Comfortable, Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality. Lightweight but very sturdy, even on a carpet. Cushion is very firm but comfortable. The back support has a decent width (10.25 inches wide) so I never feel like I'm going to slide off one side or the other (like some other cheaper/narrow benches). Seat width is 14 inches at the widest part which is also good. The back and seat rests are super easy to adjust using the spring-loaded quick-release pins, so there's virtually no wasted time unscrewing/rescrewing bolts. Just pull and adjust. Every piece of gym equipment should use these pins. It also folds in half using 1 locking pin, so you store it away in 5 seconds. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Joe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for in-home workouts
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I purchased this, along with the Core Fitness adjustable dumbbells during the COVID-19 quarantine to workout from home. I couldn’t be happier. I needed a sturdy and adjustable bench that permits many types of workouts in a small space. This hits the spot! Super strong, a lot of positions, and folds up small against the wall. I can hit so many muscle groups with such a small footprint, including back, tris, bis, core, shoulders, traps, etc. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor life

customer_reviews.title: Functional Bench
customer_reviews.text: Product works fine in general. Not sure that the price premium over other normal benches is worth the extra money.. One of the decline settings on the bench does not work. At $200 a bench, you'd expect every single setting to work. It is after all a bench When people weighing+200lbs use it, there is a definite loss of stability. And it doesn't feel particularly sturdy. It's been a month and no accidents so far. So touch wood that there won't be a disaster. I recommend visiting your local gym or fitness supply company first before committing to buying this bench.
customer_reviews.author: EZTEXAN

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very compact
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take advantage of being foldable, since I live in an apartment without much space. The bench is wide and comfortable, extremely easy to assemble, and to put away. It’s not as great as a Commercial grade bench, it wiggles a little bit, and I have issues with its grip to the floor. My tile seems to be slippery. (I will need to fix this separately).
customer_reviews.author: Augusto Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: Thin upholstery and narrow foot pads
customer_reviews.text: Two areas needing improvement which dropped this down to 4 Stars: First is the upholstery material (see photo) not being thick or sturdy compared to other quality workout benches. With frequent use, I foresee this getting torn up in a short period of time because it is also loosely upholstered and not padded enough. Second, the foot pads are barely wider than the bench (see photos) which maybe okay if you have a thin frame. But I need wider foot pads because I have a wider stance to keep great control of the bench. Everything else is great! Very portable and it has all the incline and decline settings I need to accomplish my workouts.
customer_reviews.author: M. P. DeJesus

customer_reviews.title: Good for its Purpose, with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Good for its purpose (Most important thing) -Very easy to transport & store with the folding feature Cons: -In just under one month, one of the seams started to fray. I knew that I would eventually need to reupholster it, but after just one month with only a couple people using it is pretty quick. -Rubber guards on legs constantly slip off. It's not that big of a deal, but I'm definitely considering putting superglue on them to keep them in place. -Taller than typical gym bench. This isn't really a problem for me (5'9), but my girlfriend (5'2) finds that it is very awkward, and puts her out of position for some exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great bench!
customer_reviews.text: The adjustments are smooth and work well. The plastic foot adjustment wheel was broken out of the box but I was able to epoxy it back together (is not an adjustment that is used much anyway). Would be nice if the padding was a little thicker (half of it is board) but it does the job. I would recommend this for the average person. If you’re big time into working out a lot or using heavy weights I would upgrade to a bench with a wider base. Overall I’m very satusfied!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Raihala

customer_reviews.title: Great product, love it !
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. Easy to use and store. Would highly recommend for home workouts. A few additional things to own along with this are: 1. Nice pair of adjustable dumb-bells. 2. A big box of large brown eggs/Whey proteins. 3. A few dozen bananas. 4. A large jug of iced alkaline water. And you are good to go !
customer_reviews.author: gaurav singh

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Compact but not for Power Lifting
customer_reviews.text: Although it's probably obvious you shouldn't be trying to bench 350+ with this. If you're high reps or lower weight it is pretty solid. I'm around 250 and do supine/decline with 225 and this is fine. It's great that I can do incline, supine, decline, military's with this and it folds up neatly. For the price it is worth it. I had a soloflex bench that was similar but not as versatile and cost a hell of a lot more. If you're a gym gorilla don't think you'll be able to use this for 440lb bench presses, take it down a notch and you an use this. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry McCaffrey

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and Functional Weight Bench
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small weight bench that would hold me (plus weights) and be able to fold up for more space in our work-out room when not in use. The FlyBird fits the bill on both counts. The bench is sturdy, but lightweight. It's a breeze to open up, adjust, and use. The padding is about right for me and the cushioned foot hooks are a bonus for crunches. Additionally, I was able to catch it on-sale for $30 off, always nice...
customer_reviews.author: Spiker

customer_reviews.title: Average Quality not very stable over all
customer_reviews.text: I bought it when it was on sale...Thought I got a good deal but after I got it, the over all feeling is just so so. the assembly process was easy but it feels light and not very sturdy. When I doing work out I can feel it has slightly rattle because the base is not heavy enough. For the money I paid I would expect something more sturdy
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great weight bench for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -folds and stands against the wall -lots of options for incline and decline. even the seat can go lower! -Really sturdy and feels secure. Cons: -kinda wide. I'm not too big of a guy but it's just a little too wide to be perfect for me personally. This could obviously be a pro to others. Can still sit on it comfortably though, just a little difficult to move my legs around it. Especially since I workout in a cramp space. At the end of the day though, it's a really good workout bench and I'm very happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product is EXTREMELY CHEAPLY made! It is unsafe. It is not sturdy. The padding is wearing off after ONE use! This product is ridiculously overpriced. Flybird should be very concerned about selling a product so poorly made as someone is bound to get severely injured. I want my money back!
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This bench is not very stable, used it a couple times and decided I won't trust it when lifting. It's folding feature makes it pretty unstable and feels "rickety" It's good for body weight workouts and ab exercises, the 2 decline settings are either too steep or not steep enough for a decline bench press/fly. It should be a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: J. Brandle

customer_reviews.title: Overall Great DUMBELL Bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench was a great purchase. No assembly required except putting the foot bar on which took ten seconds. The bench is sturdy (I am 6'3" at 290) there is no flex with this thing. I have mine on an inch thick carpet so this thing does not budge. A couple items worth noting is that this is a DUMBELL bench. It says so on the box. Also, it is a bit high off of the ground which for me isn't much of a a problem but I could see there being issues for shorter people. Folding up for storage is easy and convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Jubes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Just about perfect for my needs. Assembly (if you can even call it that) took about 1 minute. So easy!I am a 5'4" woman so I am NOT a giant man benching massive quantities of weight so I can't speak to how it would handle that, but I love that it has incline and decline and is much more stable/sturdy than I expected. The gap between seat and bench is a little bigger than I'd like but that's getting pretty picky. Overall, when I am in the position of replacing my 3 times a week trips to the gym with my improvised home workout, I could not be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Pogodog

customer_reviews.title: Super Heavy Duty & Foldable
customer_reviews.text: This product is super heavy duty. My husband and I are 170lbs and lift professionally and this weight bench matches the high quality you would find in a professional gym. Also it folds up so you can store it out of the way when you want to reclaim your space. Also, the variety of work out positions for the bench are perfect, you can sit at in incline and or a decline with a quick pull of the bench release lever. In addition you even have a paddled leg bar, where you you can do sit ups! I strongly recommend this bench to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: SEAMAZON10

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment.
customer_reviews.text: First off: I definitely have been spinning my wheel on spending 2x what a bench cost pre-covid. I'm glad I finally just accepted the reality of what is now the new normal -you're going to have to pay- in order to keep those gains while in quarantine. That being said: I'm glad I bought it. Its easy to assemble, sturdy and has helped me diversify my workout routine. Alot of people complained about it being too tall. That wasn't been my experience with it (though I am 5'11). It's height is actually a good thing cause I like to do Seal rows which requires more height than a standard size bench.
customer_reviews.author: James Till

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price - more for tall people.
customer_reviews.text: This bench is pretty decent overall. It is easy to assemble and folds up very nicely to store away if needed. The construction and bench seat and back materials are a good quality. I am 6 feet tall and feel the seat is a bit high off the ground, particularly when adjusted at an angle. When in decline position, bench is very awkward to get on and off and the footrest / foot pad is too far away from the seat to be used as intended to anchor your feet. But as I said - this is pretty good bench overall, best used in flat or incline positions.
customer_reviews.author: Joe M

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This bench is higher than normal when in flat position for chest press feet barley make it to the floor I'm 5'11 for reference also rubber feet are extremely loose always falls off after slight movement leaving the bare metal to scratch your floor in my case I have it on rubber mats but still messes them up pretty good also when one of the rubber feet come off it's not very stable having to stop workout and put feet back on due to pandemic not many options available so will have to keep for now gonna try to find a way to glue or put a screw into the feet to keep in place
customer_reviews.author: steph

customer_reviews.title: A company that stands behind their product.
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit unstable when lifting heavier weights laying flat. From the sitting position or incline it works a lot better. I'm disappointed with the staples that hold the seams together at the edges. Less then a month and a half of usage and they are coming out. It's an easy fix to put some in, but should not be needed. Overall, it's an ok bench, but I'd shop around a bit to look for better quality. UPDATE: The company reached out to me about my issues and offered to take care of the them. That is truly great customer service and deserves a 5 star rating for that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Gagnebin

customer_reviews.title: Good for Dumbbell Workouts in Small Spaces
customer_reviews.text: It's a decent bench that sets up and adjusts angles quickly and fairly easily. The bench is higher up than many benches you would find in the gym, so your feet may not be able to rest flat on the ground. It is fairly stable in the lower positions, but when you raise the incline on the back for any sort of seated presses, a lot of sway is added into the mix. It folds away quickly and fairly easily, making it ideal for smaller living spaces. I received a discount for this item, and for the sub $100 price I paid, it's a decent bench.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: You can do better
customer_reviews.text: The bench was very easy to assemble but the quality of it is questionable. I ended up returning it a couple of days after I received the delivery. I would suggest spending a little extra cash to get a better product like the Powerblock sports bench, which has a 10 year warranty on the frame and a reputable name backing it.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Easy Assembly, Sturdy, Height Could be Lower
customer_reviews.text: This bench is definitely sturdy, easy to assemble, and stabile. My only negative is that it is a bit too high for a person of my height (5 ft. 2 in.). That's the only reason I gave it a 4. With certain exercises, I can't put my feet comletely and firmly flat on the ground. I manage by putting my feet on the bench (as I would if I was on the floor) or putting my toes on the ground with heels up. Not ideal situation for me. But it is a quality bench and I reccommend for most people.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easily folded up after every use
customer_reviews.text: Great product. It easily adjusts to different settings. There is no wobble or creaking. It’s very compact when folded up. I fold it after every workout and store in the corner of the room, which takes mere seconds each time. One minor thing I think should be fixed, is that the safety pin which needs to be inserted when using the bench is not tethered in anyway to the bench when it isn’t in use. It could easily be lost this way. Some sort of springy nylon material attached to the bench and pin or perhaps a storing compartment would be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I don't think there's a better bench out there. Thick, sturdy pad. Incline and decline positions set with a pin, so no accidental changing of position. Bench arrives fully assembled except for the leg brace, so you're ready to go in seconds. Cons: When bench is in a flat position, it can be a little unstable if you put your weight towards the "head" end (because bench can decline, maximum stability is at the joint between back and butt pads. Back Pad came upside down (as shown in photo).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Foster

customer_reviews.title: Supports 620lbs????
customer_reviews.text: Would definitely recommend for at home workouts. The bench is very versatile and can accommodate many exercises and workouts. However.....i would not say it can support 620lbs..... i am 6’2” 225 and every time i sit on the bench it spreads out and creeks a little. I bench mid-high 300’s and i would definitely not feel comfortable benching on this. Even with that being said, for at home workouts i could not be happier with it.
customer_reviews.author: Forrest richardson

customer_reviews.title: Basic of the basic
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. Ok does the job but for how long. Cheap non vinyl fabric and the bench seems a bit higher then commercial gym benches. I'd say at least 3 inches to high, I'm 5'-11 and my feet are flat on the floor while bench pressing dumbells. This bench my feet are tippy toeing?!
customer_reviews.author: DeeTee

customer_reviews.title: Good low cost bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench was a 2020 top FID bench. It's stable and has enough different positions to give the angle needed. Two issues seen: the rubber feet roll off very easy. They will need glued on at some point. The other is the bench has a side to side slope in it looking from the top or bottom of the bench. Using a level to gauge this, the slope is quite apparent but pressing into the padding, it does go flat eventually so concern for different angled movements are not a concern.
customer_reviews.author: garyneth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use as per Expectation
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice Value for Money Deal to make a small place into a Gym . I found bench slighter higher but it delivers best to feature showcases. Its really fast folding and since I am a average weight person it is not heavy to move around. So far with 100 pounds it is considerable stable. The Bench is padded nicely and displays the quality of workmanship thats gone into it. Overall Highly satisfied and will definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Harjeet

customer_reviews.title: Ok with a couple issues
customer_reviews.text: Overall not a bad bench. Comes almost completely assembled and seems solid. My two complaints are that it’s a bit high. I do have shorter legs (30” inseam) but when I use this for bench press my feet can’t touch the ground to stabilize. Needs to be about 4-6” closer to the ground. Rear legs also need to be a bit wider for stability. I can work around both issues (4x4 on either side where feet are) but it’s a pain. No problems doing military press or incline press.
customer_reviews.author: Primal

customer_reviews.title: Great workout bench
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6' and have no issues with the height - this was my biggest concern when purchasing the unit based on other reviews. It's questionably leather (I don't think it is), but whatever material covers the foam is soft and hopefully holds up over time. It folds easily and is quite stable when in use. Assuming it last a bit, I would probably buy again unless I found a similar product that was real leather.
customer_reviews.author: JohnG

customer_reviews.title: OK Product, Fantastic Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I had this bench just days shy of the expiration of it's warranty when a part failed. I contacted the seller directly. Man, they were all over it! I expected some grief about 'it's a year old and it's not a day-to-day' warranty or questions about 'how much were you lifting' (and I was well under the weight)... Nope, instead they were 'we're sorry this happened. It's on backorder and as soon as we know something you will. And that is exactly how it happened. Could not be happier with these guys!
customer_reviews.author: Saltydog

customer_reviews.title: Good bench so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Used for flat, incline and decline bench primarily and it holds up. Decline and incline bench felt like gym quality. I have not used for shoulder press yet, I’ve tested it and it feels good. Only used around 180lbs so far not including my weight (170). Felt sturdy, no creaks or wobbling. Ankle rest has 2 settings for taller ppl. I’m 5’11” and the closer setting works for me. I would say the max height for a person is 6’ 4/5”. I’m happy and satisfied to workout during pandemic. Shipping took under 2 weeks. Price is decent compared to legit gym quality bench.
customer_reviews.author: Demetrius

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.text: Had it since June, im 220 lbs and this thing is still working the way its supposed to. The cushion is decent. Folds and stores easily. Very stable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Razaele

customer_reviews.title: fantastic bench
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic work out bench. It's solidly built and comfortable at any adjusted height. I know there are cheaper benches out there, but I like to feel the bench I'm on is solid. Most benches I've used that are cheaper feel like it when you're on them with some weight. As for the adjustment capabilities of this bench...well, it adjusts for both incline and decline (both the seat and back support). It's easy to fold up for storage. As far as assembly, there really isn't any. Pull it out of the box and unfold it and secure it with a pin. Easy stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy so far... Annoying design. Tolerable.
customer_reviews.text: Don't try moving the bench.. at all. Or you'll have to keep putting the rubber pads back in every single time. Only Giving 3 stars because it's sturdy enough to use. Otherwise is rare it less. Im using this during COVID-19 pandemic and plan on returning to a real gym in due time. Not recommending this product for a real at home gym.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It does the job 4 stars really 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: It is good, and does the job. Not like really low quality, just good bench. It can be set for incline or decline positions and is foldable type bench. However, the decline position is very problematic, as there is a space between the seat and the moving back of the bench. Decline also will be touch for short people, as the leg will be streched out, leading to pain in knees. I guess if they didn't have that space between the bench seat and the bench back, it would be best product. Note: That space is because the bench can be folded at that position.
customer_reviews.author: Yousef Khuraibut

customer_reviews.title: It's Ok
customer_reviews.text: This bench appeared to be solid made in the photos. Once we set it up, I don't think the middle hinge will last. When you put weight on the bench, the legs spread out further. I see this as a weak spot destined to fail. Of course the heavier the athlete, the more these legs spread apart, putting even greater stress on the center joint. Had I known it was "portable", I would not have gotten it. Going to reinforce the feet so they no longer spread out.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Sturdiness issues
customer_reviews.text: For anyone considering this product, note that it weighs 26 lbs. That tells you what you can expect in terms of sturdiness and stability. While the lightness has its benefits for quick setup/storage and moving around in cluttered areas, I can feel the product moving beneath me as I exercise. I do not feel comfortable doing anything that doesn’t involve at least one foot firmly planted on the ground. If you are not planted and your motions are not completely symmetrical, you will risk tilting over. This will be even more pronounced if you exercise over carpet (which I do not). FWIW, I’m 6’0” and 190 lbs, so perhaps the lack of sturdiness is amplified by my size
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Good company
customer_reviews.text: The company is very good to work with if you have any issues or questions. They (Dean Glover) have reached out to me to make sure I was completely happy with my purchase and bent over backwards to make things right. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Luke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy weight bench, great for home gym
customer_reviews.text: This gym bench is a bit high from the ground compared to others. I prefer this as it puts less strain on my legs but is something to get adjusted to. The quality is really nice and it arrived 95% assembled. All you have to do is attach the leg mount which takes 30 seconds. It’s great for my home gym as COVID made outside gyms reckless and I definitely won’t be visiting one for the next year or so. I will update my review if anything changes but I am very happy with the bench.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Z

customer_reviews.title: Want to love it but way too tall/big...
customer_reviews.text: I want to love this product but it is wayyy too tall and big. I'm 5'4 and this bench is not designed for shorter people. My feet barely reach the floor. The seat is way too long.. I can't do hip thrusts either. I wish I took a look at the measurements first :(. Please reconsider purchasing if youre shorter than 5'6.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: FlyBird Weight Bench
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this weight bench. Unfortunately, I have not been able to use it yet due to recent abdominal surgery and subsequent eight lifting restrictions. However, the construction, fit, and workmanship of the bench all appears to be top-level. I love the fact it comes completely assembled except a quick addition of the leg roller/restraint foam section. I am looking forward to putting the bench to use as soon as my doctor clears me for action!
customer_reviews.author: Big Smooth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the garage or home gym
customer_reviews.text: No assembly required, just unfold and you're ready to go. It's plenty sturdy and stable, although it's not the rock solid professional bench you'll find at your local gym. It it does flex a little and groan a tiny bit when a 200 lb guy presses 100 lbs, but feels perfectly safe and predictable and hasn't loosened up at all since I got it. Although I don't fold it up, it folds really easily if you need to stow it. If you're looking for a home or garage bench, get this one and don't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Numb D. Plum

customer_reviews.title: Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: If you actually lift a decent amount of weight would not get this. For o e it sits to high up of the ground compared to other benches. As far as the sturdiness goes, I don’t trust it... it feels pretty wobbly. I used it doing 225lbs incline barbell presses and was a bit weary. Today I was doing 85lbs incline dB presses and was very scared it was gonna collapse. I am not a fan of this at all! I suppose if you are just a weekend warrior type of gym person it’s probably fine but if you actually move weight don’t buy it!
customer_reviews.author: jeff hetnar

customer_reviews.title: Like to stay safe? Don’t buy this find one for half the price and better :)
customer_reviews.text: The product is a five stars if it costed 50$. But however, it was $179 at the time of my purchase. The entire bench is poorly made with many other reviews including mine noticing that it does not sit even on the floor and wobbles while being used. Unless you are benching anything less than 100, this product will most likely cause you injury.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Compact but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: We have a rogue bench but it’s a bit ripped up so we decided to get a new bench that had an incline. This looked pretty promising and the price was great so we decided to give it a try. It ships pretty compact and was VERY easy to set up. We just had to unfold it and instal the leg bar - probably took a whole 5 minutes or less. It’s very easy to adjust the incline so we are able to use it for all types of weight lifting. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Emanuel

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s been less than two months since I purchased this bench and the seams are already coming apart. I don’t use this bench the vigorously for it to be coming apart at the seems, especially in an area that isn’t touched often. Very disappointed in the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

customer_reviews.title: I appreciate this find
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for an affordable bench for sometime now. Something I can put away and also has a decline adjustment. This bench is great for that. Easy to store and is safe. Description said it can hold up to 500 lbs , I myself weight 200 bench about 100 for the weights, it feel stable. Other reviews said it was tall but I am 5'8" and I reach jsut fine. Overall first find, especially on Amazon. Definitely will recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Aunt B

customer_reviews.title: Good bench but has a couple of QC/QA issues
customer_reviews.text: The bench is very versatile would have been great except a couple things: - the holes for the locking pin aren't perfectly aligned and it's pretty difficult to insert the pin. If you just push it in, it will not work. You need to fold the bench just slightly and then push the pin. Considering a small size hole clearance it could be painful. - The area where you sit arrived with a dent in a cushion. I thought it would go away after a few weeks, but no luck there.. Considering the price of the bench I'm a bit frustrated..
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: So EASY!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to put together. If I could give it 6 stars for how easy it was I would. It comes folded in the box, you unfold it.... and you’re done! If you want the foot hold you can screw it on and put the support pin in but this was the most amazing self-assembly of my life.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah F

customer_reviews.title: Assembly? What assembly?
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and packaged very well. Cardboard outer box was torn but the styro that protects the bench did it's job. Literally pullout of box, unfolded and was ready to go. Super simple to customize for my lifting. The top long part of bench seems wider than other benches and I like that. Love that if is very easy to fold and store! A real space saver. The material cushioned just right. Definitely would buy again
customer_reviews.author: BigJSalami

customer_reviews.title: NOT strong. Frame broke at 300lb weight
customer_reviews.text: This bench broke when I was just warming up with weights. I weigh 200lb and Im carrying 100lb barbell weight during warm up and the base frame broke suddenly. I was lucky the the barbell didn't fall on me. Don't buy this cheap quality bench and put yourself under risk.
customer_reviews.author: Abhiram Reddy Sannapareddy

customer_reviews.title: Strong, Sturdy, Compact, Easy to use and put away
customer_reviews.text: My favorite feature is how it folds and fits in a relatively small space. PROS It was mostly assembled when it arrived in the box. Took about 3 minutes to do attach the foot rest and remove packaging. Very easy to use and put away. CONS The height feels a bit higher than some other benches I have used. There is a slight give to the bench seat which makes me feel that it might be wobbly. However, it’s really strong and well built, so it’s more of an illusion due to a little movement.
customer_reviews.author: Sparkkle

customer_reviews.title: Not sure where all the positive reviews are coming from, but look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: For the $200 I paid for this thing, it's absolutely not worth it. Feels EXTREMELY flimsy and unstable. As others have mentioned, it's also unusually high off the ground making it difficult to pick up/lower heavy dumbbells safely. Another huge red flag is that the frame pins for both the upper/lower parts of the bench do not extend all the way through the frame, putting all the stress at the pin's entry point - sure to fail after a while. Avoid. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: H. W. Jones Jr PHD

customer_reviews.title: Good home bench
customer_reviews.text: This bench does the job and easy to store if space is limited. Flat and incline settings work as expected. The leg holder is subpar and the foam tears easily. The price is a 5 star (not worth the listed price at 300, spent well under 200). Flat bench setting maybe high for others, works well for me 5'11" the incline setting is limited not as stable at a professional gym/quality. Overall for the price, space needed and functionality it is a 4 star. There are more sturdy and solid options that may fit your needs, but FlyBird works and you may consider.
customer_reviews.author: Mental Health

product_meta.title: FLYBIRD Weight Bench, Adjustable Strength Training Bench for Full Body Workout with Fast Folding- 2020 Version
feature_bullets: ✅【FLYBIRD】Design and produce fitness equipment for 20 years. Especially in WEIGHT BENCH, the bench was designed with advice of professional coach. You need a durable bench, Not a one month bench.
✅【2020 HIGH QUALITY BENCH】Made of commercial thickness steel, past thousands of weight test to ensure safety for workout everytime, Not the mendacious bench

✅【620 LBS WEIGHT CAPACITY】Designed a unique frame with triangular structure and made of heavy-duty commercial quality steel, which is very sturdy and durable, suitable for general bench presses. All this is especially important in your workout.

✅【FAST ADJUSTMENT with AUTOMATIC LOCK】Designed with 7 back positions & 3 seat positions to fit your Full Body Workout, you just pull the FAST BOLT, adjust the place which fit yourself and automatic lock! Safety!

✅【2" SOFT FOAM PADDING】10.6" Upgraded backrest and seat made of leather and filled with soft foam padding to 2" NO CRACKING! Allow you do any exercise with a very comfortable feeling. (All the measurement is actual result)
✅【SAVE 80% SPACE】 FLYBIRD foldable bench, easy to carry & NO ASSEMBLY NEEDED, 30S to set up! Folded size: 30" L x 16" W x 9" H. You can put it in the corner or under the Bed when you finish workout.

✅【NO WORRY BUYING】For all FLYBIRD Bench, the measurement and capacity is actual result, NOT as others mendacious Bench, Order today and get a 1 year warranty on the frame, 30 days warranty on the pads.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
